data.name: XDatabaseMetaData
desc: provides comprehensive information about the database as a whole.

Many of the methods here return lists of information in the form of com.sun.star.sdbc.XResultSet objects. You can use the normal com.sun.star.sdbc.XRow (or com.sun.star.sdb.XColumn) methods such as com.sun.star.sdbc.XRow.getString() and com.sun.star.sdbc.XRow.getInt() to retrieve the data from these XResultSets. If a given form of metadata is not available, these methods should throw a com.sun.star.sdbc.SQLException. After calling one of the getXXX() methods, one can check whether that value is NULL with the method com.sun.star.sdbc.XRow.wasNull(). In the text only \"(may be `NULL`)\" is mentioned for this case.

Some of these methods take arguments that are String patterns. These arguments all have names such as fooPattern. Within a pattern String, \"%\" means match any substring of 0 or more characters, and \"_\" means match any one character. Only metadata entries matching the search pattern are returned. If a search pattern argument is set to VOID, that argument's criteria will be dropped from the search.

A com.sun.star.sdbc.SQLException will be thrown if a driver does not support a metadata method. In the case of methods that return an XResultSet, either an XResultSet (which may be empty) is returned or a SQLException is thrown.

methods.name: allProceduresAreCallable
desc: Can all the procedures returned by getProcedures be called by the current user?

methods.name: allTablesAreSelectable
desc: Can all the tables returned by getTable be SELECTed by the current user?

methods.name: dataDefinitionCausesTransactionCommit
desc: does a data definition statement within a transaction force the transaction to commit?

methods.name: dataDefinitionIgnoredInTransactions
desc: is a data definition statement within a transaction ignored?

methods.name: deletesAreDetected
desc: indicates whether or not a visible row delete can be detected by calling com.sun.star.sdbc.XResultSet.rowDeleted().
If deletesAreDetected() returns FALSE, then deleted rows are removed from the result set.

methods.name: doesMaxRowSizeIncludeBlobs
desc: Did getMaxRowSize() include LONGVARCHAR and LONGVARBINARY blobs?

methods.name: getBestRowIdentifier
desc: gets a description of a table's optimal set of columns that uniquely identifies a row.
They are ordered by SCOPE.
Each column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getCatalogSeparator
desc: return the separator between catalog and table name

methods.name: getCatalogTerm
desc: return the database vendor's preferred term for \"catalog\"

methods.name: getCatalogs
desc: gets the catalog names available in this database.
The results are ordered by catalog name.
The catalog column is:

methods.name: getColumnPrivileges
desc: gets a description of the access rights for a table's columns.
Only privileges matching the column name criteria are returned. They are ordered by COLUMN_NAME and PRIVILEGE.
Each privilege description has the following columns:

methods.name: getColumns
desc: gets a description of table columns available in the specified catalog.
Only column descriptions matching the catalog, schema, table and column name criteria are returned. They are ordered by TABLE_SCHEM, TABLE_NAME, and ORDINAL_POSITION.
Each column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getConnection
desc: retrieves the connection that produced this metadata object.

methods.name: getCrossReference
desc: gets a description of the foreign key columns in the foreign key table that reference the primary key columns of the primary key table (describe how one table imports another's key.) This should normally return a single foreign key/primary key pair (most tables only import a foreign key from a table once.).
They are ordered by FKTABLE_CAT, FKTABLE_SCHEM, FKTABLE_NAME, and KEY_SEQ.
Each foreign key column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getDatabaseProductName
desc: returns the name of the database product.

methods.name: getDatabaseProductVersion
desc: returns the version of the database product.

methods.name: getDefaultTransactionIsolation
desc: return the database default transaction isolation level.
The values are defined in com.sun.star.sdbc.TransactionIsolation.

methods.name: getDriverMajorVersion
desc: returns the SDBC driver major version number.

methods.name: getDriverMinorVersion
desc: returns the SDBC driver minor version number.

methods.name: getDriverName
desc: returns the name of the SDBC driver.

methods.name: getDriverVersion
desc: returns the version number of the SDBC driver.

methods.name: getExportedKeys
desc: gets a description of the foreign key columns that reference a table's primary key columns (the foreign keys exported by a table).
They are ordered by FKTABLE_CAT, FKTABLE_SCHEM, FKTABLE_NAME, and KEY_SEQ.
Each foreign key column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getExtraNameCharacters
desc: gets all the \"extra\" characters that can be used in unquoted identifier names (those beyond a-z, A-Z, 0-9 and _).

methods.name: getIdentifierQuoteString
desc: What's the string used to quote SQL identifiers? This returns a space \" \" if identifier quoting is not supported.

methods.name: getImportedKeys
desc: gets a description of the primary key columns that are referenced by a table's foreign key columns (the primary keys imported by a table).
They are ordered by PKTABLE_CAT, PKTABLE_SCHEM, PKTABLE_NAME, and KEY_SEQ.
Each primary key column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getIndexInfo
desc: gets a description of a table's indices and statistics.
They are ordered by NON_UNIQUE, TYPE, INDEX_NAME, and ORDINAL_POSITION.
Each index column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getMaxBinaryLiteralLength
desc: return the maximal number of hex characters in an inline binary literal

methods.name: getMaxCatalogNameLength
desc: return the maximum length of a catalog name

methods.name: getMaxCharLiteralLength
desc: return the max length for a character literal

methods.name: getMaxColumnNameLength
desc: return the limit on column name length

methods.name: getMaxColumnsInGroupBy
desc: return the maximum number of columns in a \"GROUP BY\" clause

methods.name: getMaxColumnsInIndex
desc: return the maximum number of columns allowed in an index

methods.name: getMaxColumnsInOrderBy
desc: return the maximum number of columns in an \"ORDER BY\" clause

methods.name: getMaxColumnsInSelect
desc: return the maximum number of columns in a \"SELECT\" list

methods.name: getMaxColumnsInTable
desc: return the maximum number of columns in a table

methods.name: getMaxConnections
desc: return the number of active connections at a time to this database.

methods.name: getMaxCursorNameLength
desc: return the maximum cursor name length

methods.name: getMaxIndexLength
desc: return the maximum length of an index (in bytes)

methods.name: getMaxProcedureNameLength
desc: return the maximum length of a procedure name

methods.name: getMaxRowSize
desc: return the maximum length of a single row.

methods.name: getMaxSchemaNameLength
desc: return the maximum length allowed for a schema name

methods.name: getMaxStatementLength
desc: return the maximum length of a SQL statement

methods.name: getMaxStatements
desc: return the maximal number of open active statements at one time to this database

methods.name: getMaxTableNameLength
desc: return the maximum length of a table name

methods.name: getMaxTablesInSelect
desc: return the maximum number of tables in a SELECT statement

methods.name: getMaxUserNameLength
desc: return the maximum length of a user name

methods.name: getNumericFunctions
desc: gets a comma-separated list of math functions.
These are the X/Open CLI math function names used in the SDBC function escape clause.

methods.name: getPrimaryKeys
desc: gets a description of a table's primary key columns.
They are ordered by COLUMN_NAME.
Each primary key column description has the following columns:

methods.name: getProcedureColumns
desc: gets a description of a catalog's stored procedure parameters and result columns.

Only descriptions matching the schema, procedure and parameter name criteria are returned. They are ordered by PROCEDURE_SCHEM and PROCEDURE_NAME. Within this, the return value, if any, is first. Next are the parameter descriptions in call order. The column descriptions follow in column number order.
Each row in the XResultSet is a parameter description or column description with the following fields:
Note: Some databases may not return the column descriptions for a procedure. Additional columns beyond REMARKS can be defined by the database.

methods.name: getProcedureTerm
desc: return the database vendor's preferred term for \"procedure\"

methods.name: getProcedures
desc: Gets a description of the stored procedures available in a catalog.
Only procedure descriptions matching the schema and procedure name criteria are returned. They are ordered by PROCEDURE_SCHEM, and PROCEDURE_NAME.
Each procedure description has the following columns:

methods.name: getSQLKeywords
desc: gets a comma-separated list of all a database's SQL keywords that are NOT also SQL92 keywords.

methods.name: getSchemaTerm
desc: return the database vendor's preferred term for \"schema\"

methods.name: getSchemas
desc: Gets the schema names available in this database.
The results are ordered by schema name.
The schema column is:

methods.name: getSearchStringEscape
desc: gets the string that can be used to escape wildcard characters.
This is the string that can be used to escape \"_\" or \"%\" in the string pattern style catalog search parameters.
The \"_\" character represents any single character.
The \"%\" character represents any sequence of zero or more characters.

methods.name: getStringFunctions
desc: gets a comma-separated list of string functions.
These are the X/Open CLI string function names used in the SDBC function escape clause.

methods.name: getSystemFunctions
desc: gets a comma-separated list of system functions.
These are the X/Open CLI system function names used in the SDBC function escape clause.

methods.name: getTablePrivileges
desc: gets a description of the access rights for each table available in a catalog.

Note that a table privilege applies to one or more columns in the table. It would be wrong to assume that this privilege applies to all columns (this may be TRUE for some systems but is not TRUE for all.)
Only privileges matching the schema and table name criteria are returned. They are ordered by TABLE_SCHEM, TABLE_NAME, and PRIVILEGE.
Each privilege description has the following columns:

methods.name: getTableTypes
desc: gets the table types available in this database.
The results are ordered by table type.
The table type is:

methods.name: getTables
desc: gets a description of tables available in a catalog.
Only table descriptions matching the catalog, schema, table name, and type criteria are returned. They are ordered by TABLE_TYPE, TABLE_SCHEM, and TABLE_NAME.
Each table description has the following columns:
Note: Some databases may not return information for all tables.

methods.name: getTimeDateFunctions
desc: gets a comma-separated list of time and date functions.

methods.name: getTypeInfo
desc: gets a description of all the standard SQL types supported by this database.
They are ordered by DATA_TYPE and then by how closely the data type maps to the corresponding SDBC SQL type.
Each type description has the following columns:

methods.name: getUDTs
desc: Gets a description of the user-defined types defined in a particular schema.
Schema-specific UDTs may have type OBJECT, STRUCT, or DISTINCT.

Only types matching the catalog, schema, type name, and type criteria are returned. They are ordered by DATA_TYPE, TYPE_SCHEM, and TYPE_NAME. The type name parameter may be a fully-qualified name. In this case, the catalog and schemaPattern parameters are ignored.
Each type description has the following columns:
Note: If the driver does not support UDTs, an empty result set is returned.

methods.name: getURL
desc: returns the URL for the database connection

methods.name: getUserName
desc: returns the user name from this database connection.

methods.name: getVersionColumns
desc: gets a description of a table's columns that are automatically updated when any value in a row is updated.
They are unordered.
Each column description has the following columns:

methods.name: insertsAreDetected
desc: indicates whether or not a visible row insert can be detected by calling com.sun.star.sdbc.XResultSet.rowInserted().

methods.name: isCatalogAtStart
desc: Does a catalog appear at the start of a qualified table name? (Otherwise it appears at the end)

methods.name: isReadOnly
desc: checks if the database in read-only mode.

methods.name: nullPlusNonNullIsNull
desc: are concatenations between NULL and non-NULL values NULL?

methods.name: nullsAreSortedAtEnd
desc: Are NULL values sorted at the end, regardless of sort order?

methods.name: nullsAreSortedAtStart
desc: Are NULL values sorted at the start regardless of sort order?

methods.name: nullsAreSortedHigh
desc: Are NULL values sorted high?

methods.name: nullsAreSortedLow
desc: Are NULL values sorted low?

methods.name: othersDeletesAreVisible
desc: indicates whether deletes made by others are visible.

methods.name: othersInsertsAreVisible
desc: indicates whether inserts made by others are visible.

methods.name: othersUpdatesAreVisible
desc: indicates whether updates made by others are visible.

methods.name: ownDeletesAreVisible
desc: indicates whether a result set's own deletes are visible.

methods.name: ownInsertsAreVisible
desc: indicates whether a result set's own inserts are visible.

methods.name: ownUpdatesAreVisible
desc: indicates whether a result set's own updates are visible.

methods.name: storesLowerCaseIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case unquoted SQL identifiers as case insensitive and store them in lower case?

methods.name: storesLowerCaseQuotedIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case quoted SQL identifiers as case insensitive and store them in lower case?

methods.name: storesMixedCaseIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case unquoted SQL identifiers as case insensitive and store them in mixed case?

methods.name: storesMixedCaseQuotedIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case quoted SQL identifiers as case insensitive and store them in mixed case?

methods.name: storesUpperCaseIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case unquoted SQL identifiers as case insensitive and store them in upper case?

methods.name: storesUpperCaseQuotedIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case quoted SQL identifiers as case insensitive and store them in upper case?

methods.name: supportsAlterTableWithAddColumn
desc: support the Database \"ALTER TABLE\" with add column?

methods.name: supportsAlterTableWithDropColumn
desc: support the Database \"ALTER TABLE\" with drop column?

methods.name: supportsBatchUpdates
desc: indicates whether the driver supports batch updates.

methods.name: supportsCatalogsInDataManipulation
desc: Can a catalog name be used in a data manipulation statement?

methods.name: supportsCatalogsInIndexDefinitions
desc: Can a catalog name be used in an index definition statement?

methods.name: supportsCatalogsInPrivilegeDefinitions
desc: Can a catalog name be used in a privilege definition statement?

methods.name: supportsCatalogsInProcedureCalls
desc: Can a catalog name be used in a procedure call statement?

methods.name: supportsCatalogsInTableDefinitions
desc: Can a catalog name be used in a table definition statement?

methods.name: supportsColumnAliasing
desc: support the Database column aliasing?
The SQL AS clause can be used to provide names for computed columns or to provide alias names for columns as required.

methods.name: supportsConvert
desc: TRUE , if the Database supports the CONVERT between the given SQL types otherwise FALSE.

methods.name: supportsCoreSQLGrammar
desc: TRUE, if the database supports ODBC Core SQL grammar, otherwise FALSE.

methods.name: supportsCorrelatedSubqueries
desc: Are correlated subqueries supported?

methods.name: supportsDataDefinitionAndDataManipulationTransactions
desc: support the Database both data definition and data manipulation statements within a transaction?

methods.name: supportsDataManipulationTransactionsOnly
desc: are only data manipulation statements within a transaction supported?

methods.name: supportsDifferentTableCorrelationNames
desc: If table correlation names are supported, are they restricted to be different from the names of the tables?

methods.name: supportsExpressionsInOrderBy
desc: Are expressions in \"ORDER BY\" lists supported?

methods.name: supportsGroupBy
desc: Is some form of \"GROUP BY\" clause supported?

methods.name: supportsGroupByBeyondSelect
desc: Can a \"GROUP BY\" clause add columns not in the SELECT provided it specifies all the columns in the SELECT?

methods.name: supportsGroupByUnrelated
desc: Can a \"GROUP BY\" clause use columns not in the SELECT?

methods.name: supportsIntegrityEnhancementFacility
desc: returns TRUE, if the Database supports SQL Integrity Enhancement Facility, otherwise FALSE.

methods.name: supportsLikeEscapeClause
desc: Is the escape character in \"LIKE\" clauses supported?

methods.name: supportsMinimumSQLGrammar
desc: TRUE, if the database supports ODBC Minimum SQL grammar, otherwise FALSE.

methods.name: supportsMixedCaseIdentifiers
desc: use the database \"mixed case unquoted SQL identifiers\" case sensitive.

methods.name: supportsMixedCaseQuotedIdentifiers
desc: Does the database treat mixed case quoted SQL identifiers as case sensitive and as a result store them in mixed case?

methods.name: supportsMultipleResultSets
desc: Are multiple XResultSets from a single execute supported?

methods.name: supportsMultipleTransactions
desc: Can we have multiple transactions open at once (on different connections)?

methods.name: supportsNonNullableColumns
desc: Can columns be defined as non-nullable?

methods.name: supportsOpenCursorsAcrossCommit
desc: Can cursors remain open across commits?

methods.name: supportsOpenCursorsAcrossRollback
desc: Can cursors remain open across rollbacks?

methods.name: supportsOpenStatementsAcrossCommit
desc: Can statements remain open across commits?

methods.name: supportsOpenStatementsAcrossRollback
desc: Can statements remain open across rollbacks?

methods.name: supportsOrderByUnrelated
desc: Can an \"ORDER BY\" clause use columns not in the SELECT statement?

methods.name: supportsPositionedDelete
desc: Is positioned DELETE supported?

methods.name: supportsPositionedUpdate
desc: Is positioned UPDATE supported?

methods.name: supportsResultSetConcurrency
desc: Does the database support the concurrency type in combination with the given result set type?

methods.name: supportsResultSetType
desc: Does the database support the given result set type?

methods.name: supportsSchemasInDataManipulation
desc: Can a schema name be used in a data manipulation statement?

methods.name: supportsSchemasInIndexDefinitions
desc: Can a schema name be used in an index definition statement?

methods.name: supportsSchemasInPrivilegeDefinitions
desc: Can a schema name be used in a privilege definition statement?

methods.name: supportsSchemasInProcedureCalls
desc: Can a schema name be used in a procedure call statement?

methods.name: supportsSchemasInTableDefinitions
desc: Can a schema name be used in a table definition statement?

methods.name: supportsSelectForUpdate
desc: Is SELECT for UPDATE supported?

methods.name: supportsStoredProcedures
desc: Are stored procedure calls using the stored procedure escape syntax supported?

methods.name: supportsSubqueriesInComparisons
desc: Are subqueries in comparison expressions supported?

methods.name: supportsSubqueriesInExists
desc: Are subqueries in \"exists\" expressions supported?

methods.name: supportsSubqueriesInIns
desc: Are subqueries in \"in\" statements supported?

methods.name: supportsSubqueriesInQuantifieds
desc: Are subqueries in quantified expressions supported?

methods.name: supportsTableCorrelationNames
desc: Are table correlation names supported?

methods.name: supportsTransactionIsolationLevel
desc: Does this database support the given transaction isolation level?

methods.name: supportsTransactions
desc: support the Database transactions? If not, invoking the method com.sun.star.sdbc.XConnection.commit() is a noop and the isolation level is TransactionIsolation_NONE.

methods.name: supportsTypeConversion
desc: TRUE , if the Database supports the CONVERT function between SQL types, otherwise FALSE.

methods.name: supportsUnion
desc: Is SQL UNION supported?

methods.name: supportsUnionAll
desc: Is SQL UNION ALL supported?

methods.name: updatesAreDetected
desc: indicates whether or not a visible row update can be detected by calling the method XResultSet.rowUpdated.

methods.name: usesLocalFilePerTable
desc: use the database one local file to save for each table.

methods.name: usesLocalFiles
desc: use the database local files to save the tables.
